title: Three-Tier Learning Level-Based Mechatronics and Robotics Project Design: Integrated Language Learning for Technical Documentation and Communication Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mechanical engineering and electrical/electronics theory comprehension, basic grammar/vocabulary skills for technical documentation, understanding of engineering-specific terminology
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented training for industry professionals to acquire Industry 4.0 competencies, prioritizing technical report writing and presentation skills. Special emphasis is placed on enhancing language proficiency (reading, writing, speaking) to articulate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely.

learning_goals: Specific phase: Document the 3D printing robotic arm assembly process in technical writing, identify mechatronics components, and explain them using professional terminology and accurate grammar.
Representation phase: Visualize robotic kinematics concepts using motion capture system data, systematically write analysis reports, and cultivate data representation and interpretation skills.

Learners will organize simulation results (≥3) of robotic workspace design in IEEE paper format (title, abstract, methodology, results, references), logically describe optimization algorithm applications (genetic algorithm or particle swarm optimization), and clearly present ≥15% performance improvements using specialized vocabulary and precise sentence structures.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
